Changeset.Change: GWT 2 and Liferay support

Abstract search is available. Cross collection search is supported without the need of schema selection. Users can search though a list of common mapped fields depending on the current selected collections
Open search support
Custom Error Alert Window and error handling
Browse info messages have changed
Compatible with the new WorkspaceLightTree
Changes regarding the order of execution in some callbacks
Compatible with the new model of HomeLibrary
User interface redesign. The portlet's GUI has been redesigned to provide a more ease and user friendly environment
Fixed an issue with a pop-up window
GWT 2.2.0 compatible
Notification components are updated to be compatible with the GWT 2.2.0
Compatible with the new Search System
Browse is enabled for more than one selected collections
Browsing distinct values is available for the new search
Refine search panel: see results of the same query is available. The way this is achieved is changed
Removed some alert messages and redirect always do the results page independent of the problem
GCube Guide tour is added to Search portlet. It also covers the collections portlet
Semantic search integration. A checkbox is added to decide if the native or the semantic results portlet will be used
A configuration file is added. If semantic search should be enabled then a record should be added to the file for the specific scope name
Added a fallback solution for GWT2.4 and chrome 24 problem
Semantic search label is changed
SetRanking option is added to exploit fuse
Project is mavenized
Keep the state of the set ranking, and semantic enrichment options in the current session
Set to ASL the user's choice for the semantic enrichment in order to submit a different query
GWT version updated
Updated to the latest versions of HomeLibrary, WorkspaceLightTree and GuidedTour components
Renamed the portlet to Advanced Search Portlet
Updated the dependencies because of the gcore-free portal
Users can select to search per collection when they submit a search and retrieve the results separately
Updated the way the generic SQL query was submitted. This is used for queries saved to the workspace
xSearch redirect check box is visible based on the availability of the xSearch service at the current scope
